body.ab:
My dear Smyly,
I was away in town yesterday, but
went to the Bodleian today, the light being some
of the best. Here are the answers to your questions
(1) P.P.II vii line 7. I read εις τουτο for
εκ τουγ εις is quite certain. Παυνι in
M's copy isnt right.
line 11. the first symbol ῐ seems to represent
αρουρα, the second 5 artabae
13. I dont understand the symbol [symbol]. [cancellation?]
[symbol] is of course ιπ(παεχια) or some other
derivative of ἵππος. But here the symbol seems
to be Μ not Π with an l through the middle.
(2) RP II.viii col II verso the word before
τιραχθηουσνται might be read as επει. In the
next line Wilcken is, I think, right: it is γαρ.

not Παρα and ιλικοι What you took
for the second half of Ν is probably only
paint.
As for επιδανε]ζεσθαι I agree with you
ζ is unsatisfactory. ν]ιι̣σ̣α̣σθαι could be read
but it is more like λεσθαι
(3) II xiv (1a) 9.10 ως δ αν is right
he made a muddle of it first. ανενενεγ
καμενον will do. In this scrawl ον, ων
and αν are indistinguishable, but συνταγον
wont do. I am prepared to accept M's
συντασσηι
(1b) He seems to have written ουση
first (perhaps he was going to unite ουσαν)
and then scratched out ου & put in ο at
the top ἡ υγιης is right. In the
next line τιπο̣ς̣ τ̣α̣ θ̣εμελε της can be

read. He certainly didnt write θεμελια
but it is possible he inserted [greek] over the
line aftewrads, for the papyrus is rubbed
just at that point
(4) II xx col I 15 ο]θε̣ν is right.
(5) xxii 14. about 10 lettesr are lost
between χυραση̣ι̣ and απο. I cant see
any ει.
(6) XXVI (4) 2. the traces before ος will
do for ημ. Διμναιου of course is
right as in (3) 2,3 λι/μναιου του παρα
in (7) I should read τα χαλκου
[δε]αχμα[ς εξ[VERTICAL BAR] ηκοντα. But I dont
understand lines 5 and 6 where M's readings
must be wrong. I suspect a mention
of αργυριον in line 6. n.6. in (8)
too there was probably a [pegmet] in both

silver & copper. [???] are because of
a line below αεγ + εκα[τον.
Ptolemais ὅρμου is by the way
almost certainly at Illahun. Probably
the gurob papyri came from its very
cemetery.
Our boxes have come. Petrie tells me
he only found about 25 papyrus mummies.
We have parts of 120 (about 60 well
preserved), so our collection ought to be
very large, though the pectarels etc are in
most cases somewhat smaller than the Gurob
ones.
Tell Mahaffy I am very sorry he wouldnt
come here.
Yours
B.P. Grenfell.
